summary: This is a federal indictment filed against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas for conspiracy and making false records related to their failure to conduct required inmate counts and rounds at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019, during which time inmate Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide while unobserved. This is the final page of a federal indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against Bureau of Prisons correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas. It charges them with conspiracy and making false records related to the failure to perform inmate counts on Jeffrey Epstein's unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the morning of his death.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Indicted for conspiracy and falsifying records by failing to perform required inmate counts and rounds in the SHU on August 9-10, 2019, during which Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Indicted for conspiracy and falsifying records alongside Noel for failing to perform required inmate counts and rounds in the SHU on August 10, 2019, during which Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who died by suicide in his SHU cell on August 10, 2019, while Noel and Thomas failed to conduct required checks. He was detained on federal sex trafficking charges.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and filed the indictment.

connections.description: Worked together as the only two officers on duty in the SHU from 12 a.m. to 8 a.m. on August 10, 2019, and jointly failed to perform counts/rounds and falsified records.
Noel was one of the correctional officers responsible for monitoring Epstein in the SHU and escorted him to his cell on the evening of August 9, 2019.
Thomas was one of the MCC officers who responded to Epstein's prior apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and was responsible for monitoring him on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's prior apparent suicide attempt
events.description: MCC officers, including Michael Thomas, found Epstein on the floor of his SHU cell with a strip of bedsheet around his neck. He was subsequently placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Failure to conduct 4 p.m. and 10 p.m. institutional counts
events.description: Tova Noel and other officers failed to perform the required 4 p.m. and 10 p.m. inmate counts in the SHU but signed false count slips certifying they had done so.

events.title: Failure to conduct overnight counts and rounds
events.description: From 12 a.m. to 6:30 a.m., Tova Noel and Michael Thomas failed to perform the 12 a.m., 3 a.m., and 5 a.m. institutional counts and all required 30-minute rounds, while falsifying records.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's body
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., Noel and Thomas entered Epstein's tier to serve breakfast and found him unresponsive with a noose around his neck. He was later declared dead at a hospital.

events.title: False Count Slips Submitted at MCC
events.description: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas allegedly created, signed, and submitted a materially false count slip to the Metropolitan Correctional Center indicating they had performed the 5 a.m. institutional count of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) when they had not done so.

events.title: Indictment Filed Against Noel and Thomas
events.description: A federal indictment is filed in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York charging Tova Noel and Michael Thomas with conspiracy and making false records.

locations: MCC Special Housing Unit (SHU), ninth floor
keyFacts: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas are charged with conspiracy and making false records for failing to conduct mandatory inmate counts and rounds in the MCC's Special Housing Unit on August 9-10, 2019.
No institutional counts or 30-minute rounds were conducted in the SHU from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9 until 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019, despite false paperwork being submitted for each.
Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019, having committed suicide by hanging while unobserved due to the officers' dereliction of duty.
Epstein had been placed on suicide watch after a prior incident on July 23, 2019, and was supposed to have a cellmate per psychological staff direction, but was alone on the night of his death.

Video surveillance confirmed that no officer entered Epstein's tier between approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9 and 6:30 a.m. on August 10, and that Noel and Thomas were asleep or browsing the internet instead of performing duties.
Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas were federally indicted for falsifying records related to inmate counts at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The false records specifically concerned the 5 a.m. institutional count of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on August 10, 2019.
The charges include conspiracy and violations of Title 18, U.S. Code, Sections 371, 1001(a)(3), and 2.
The indictment was filed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman in the Southern District of New York.
